definition: past events/relics from a former age/ruins
surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale

sentences.english: The wet glass left a mark on the surface of the table.
sentences.chinese: 湿杯子在桌面上留下一个陈迹。

sentences.english: Make screen cluttering pop-ups a thing of the past by installing a pop-up blocker right away.
sentences.chinese: 杂波使屏幕流行起坐陈迹安装了弹起立即阻断。

sentences.english: There is nothing left to us of our days of prosperity!
sentences.chinese: 我们当年兴盛时期的陈迹一点也没能留下来。

sentences.english: Stress, headaches, tensions, anger and insomnia will truly be a thing of the past .
sentences.chinese: 压力，头痛，紧张，愤怒和失眠将真正成为历史陈迹。

sentences.english: The archaeologists found some traces of an ancient civilization in that area.
sentences.chinese: 考古学家们在那个地区发现了一些古代文明的陈迹。

sentences.english: He attempts to demolish the trace of reality and replace it with relics of time.
sentences.chinese: 其作品中试图磨灭现实的质感而替换以时间的陈迹。

definition: mottled and peeling off in places
to recall/to bring to mind/to reminisce
to fade into the distance/(fig.) to peter out/to fade away
lit. abandoned by men and choked with weeds/desolate (idiom)
to visit a place for the memories/to pay homage to (the deceased)
